doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: M. M. ChavindaRavindra Vs. The Hon. Attorney General, before Hon. Amal Ranaraja, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: M. M. ChavindaRavindra Vs. The Hon. Attorney General,
latest_doc_d.keywords: Contradictions and inconsistencies in witness testimony– Presumptive evidence – Admissibility of written statements from persons who cannot be called as a witness – IB statements
latest_doc_d.legistation: Section 296 and 380 of the Penal Code, Section 114 and 33(2) of the Evidence Ordinance No. 15 of 1895
